result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose Rapheal Cruz Jr.

defendant.name: Cruz, Jose Rapheal, Jr.
defendant.address: W148N6146 Wampum Drive, Menomonee Falls, WI 53051

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jose Rapheal Cruz Jr. in court.  Attorney Dudley A. Williams in court for Jose Rapheal Cruz Jr.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense is requesting a plea/sentencing date.  Court reminds defendant that all bail conditions remain in full force and effect. Case adjourned to Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jose Rapheal Cruz in court with attorney Dudley A. Williams.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery and offer, but requests additional time to review with client.  Court scheduled a status conference.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jose Rapheal Cruz in court with Attorney Dudley A. Williams.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for status conference. Imposed and stayed warrant is cancelled. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.   
*All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 057360,
Payable Number: 1014470,
Receipt Number: 22RP024836,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Jose Rapheal Cruz not in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Dudley Williams appears as a friend of the court by video. Attorney Williams state that the defendant is under a chaper 51. Court will imposed by stay bench warrant until the next date and ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Jose Rapheal Cruz in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Jose Rapheal Cruz in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jose Rapheal Cruz appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
